com.manyangled.gibbous.optim.convex

Class CholeskySchurKKTSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.manyangled.gibbous.optim.convex.KKTSolver
      • com.manyangled.gibbous.optim.convex.CholeskySchurKKTSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.commons.math3.optim.OptimizationData

    public class CholeskySchurKKTSolver
extends KKTSolver
    Solves KKT conditions for NewtonOptimizer, using Schur block factorization and Cholesky decomposition.

    Implements (Algorithm 10.3) and Step 1 of (Algorithm 9.5) from Convex Optimization, Boyd and Vandenberghe, Cambridge University Press, 2008.

    This is currently the default KKTSolver for NewtonOptimizer.

    See also SVDSchurKKTSolver

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public KKTSolution solve(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix H,
                         org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector g)
        Description copied from class: KKTSolver
        Solve constraint-free system Hv = -g

        returns delta-x (aka v) and lambda-squared from Algorithm 9.5 of

        Convex Optimization, Boyd and Vandenberghe, Cambridge University Press, 2008.

        delta-nu (aka w, aka the dual) is returned as null

        Specified by:
        solve in class KKTSolver
        Parameters:
        H - Hessian matrix
        g - gradient, corresponding to H
        Returns:
        solution delta-x with lambda-squared

      • solve

        public KKTSolution solve(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix H,
                         org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix A,
                         org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix AT,
                         org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector g,
                         org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector h)
        Description copied from class: KKTSolver
        solve block factored matrix equation: 
         | H AT | | v | = -| g |
 | A  0 | | w |    | h |

        where (v, w) are primal/dual delta-x and "nu+" from algorithm 10.2 of

        Convex Optimization, Boyd and Vandenberghe, Cambridge University Press, 2008.

        Specified by:
        solve in class KKTSolver
        Parameters:
        H - Hessian matrix
        A - coefficient matrix of equality constraints
        AT - transpose of A
        g - gradient, corresponding to H
        h - constant vector block corresponding to A
        Returns:
        solution (delta-x, nu+)
